2 hours in and all I can say is: Wow. What an incredible game.  To fully enjoy this game you need to take it slow, explore the world and get immersed. People who rush through will miss such a big part of the game.  Everything in this game is beautiful. The music, the graphics, the environment (in terms of design), the narrators, the story and honestly, I couldn't find anything I don't like yet. Something that makes this game graphically stand out is that everything looks 'handmade'. Nothing looks like it was copied and pasted over the world to fill gaps. Every single rock looks different and realistic and everything is so detailed.  I spend about half my time by just looking at all the details and things you can see.  I could tell you so much more about how good the game feels, but I don't wanna waste your time.  To make it short. This game is a masterpiece and totally worth its money. Get it, if you love to explore immersive game worlds and a cool storyline. Do not get it, if you just wanna rush through it.

Not sure what i can say that hasnt been said but very few games can offer an immersive and moving experience like this game. Add to that some of the most impressive graphics and music and voice acting second to none and you can't not be on a winner. My wife, not a pc gamer loved this as much as me. Buy it you wont be dissapointed
The Vanishing of Ethan Carter: Breathtaking, Immersive, Unforgetting Story. I think its safe to say its my GOTY 2014

First, this game is good. Really. But not for the full price.  The visuals are stunning as the music and the sounds, but the story could have been more developped. When you finished the game you think 'what, already ?'. It takes me only six hours to complete without any help (soluce or wiki), and the 'open world' thing is a lot overestimated.  On the other hand, the global atmosphere is great and the experience so refreshing.  To finish, I can advise you to buy this game but be aware of its short duration and lack of exploration. Waiting some sales could be a better idea than to buy it at its full price.

This is one of the best mystery / adventure games I have played in a long, looong time. There's no hand holding, as they do warn you at the bginning of the game, so it's challenging, yet no so much so that it becomes frustrating. Each puzzle or 'scene' solved reveals another part of the story and I quickly became invested in it, trying to get the whole picture.   The game dynamic and the 'supernatural' methods used to gather clues are both very refreshing and novel. The game itself is visually stunning and the music is beautiful and fits the story like a glove. I recommend it wholeheartedly!

Bought this title in one of the steam sales after hearing good things. I wasn't sure i was going to like it as i sometimes don't have the patience for this type of game. However It was a joy from start to finish.  Without giving anything away there are 10 key scenes where you have to piece together the evidence, it's not too difficult but there is no hand holding so sometimes you do wander around trying to find the next piece in the puzzle. Apparantly there's no right or wrong way to play this game however i missed the opening crime scene (railcar) and proceeded onto the 2nd before going back to the 1st and for whatever reason the scene with the railcar wouldn't play out properly.....can't say too much. I'm thinking this was just a glitch and was just bad luck on behalf so i stated from the beginning and this time it all went smoothly.  I played the redux version and the graphics are stunning, the sound is atmospheric and the music haunting. The game has a strong narative so if you looking at the Steam winter sale and thinking i fancy something a bit different i would not hesitate in giving Ethan carter a go, you won't regret it.  I think i got about 8-9 hours gameplay out of this title but I would say 1-2 hours of that was trying to close out some achievements and man the unfinished story achievement is a toughy.  A strong 7/10

Beautiful. I did not realize how good this game looked when I bought it. It's well optimized and it runs flawless on my pc.  I finished the game the same day I bought it. I don't regret this purchase one bit. You are an occult investigator who received a letter from a boy asking for help. You begin the game when you arrive. Entire game is first person and well written. The voice acting is decent as well.  You seem to have some psychic abilities of your own and you use them to help solve puzzles and figure out what the hell happened to the boy and his family, and why everybody is killing each other. Nice little twist at the end. There's puzzles where you try to figure out how murders happened to ethans family and many others. They aren't too difficult either.  This is an exploration-puzzle kind of game. Not for everyone. If you think it is something you would enjoy, just buy it. It is a very good game and worth your money.
Easily one of the best stories I've yet to experience.

Great little murder mystery adventure game with a soothing relaxing atmosphere. For what it attempts to achieve it is near perfect. Added bonus is the inclusion of the remastered edition when purchasing the original. 8.2 / 10
It is a good game to kill the time when you have nothing to do. Just go into the game and watch the beautiful view with elegance background music. .....

It is a truly great excperience, its slow, not much action and sorts, and sometimes you can get stuck, but this game promeses to be a heck of a ride, it will keep you guessing till the end.  Its a story of a boy and a detective, facing a mysterious killer, who they call 'The sleeper'.

WOW! Completed the Redux version just now. I bought this game accidentaly and it was one my best gaming experiences.  Pros: 1) Stunning graphics and great designed open world 2) Great and atmospheric sound 3) Nice story 4) Interesting gameplay features and puzzles. 5) INSANE plot twist    You may think of some paranormal activity? NO, it's just a kid's imagination    Cons 1)  NO HINTS FOR YOU DUMBASS, GO HARDCORE (I enjoyed this btw, every player will play the game in his own way, in his own order)

I bought this game back in February, and I sincerely regret putting it off until now. A captivating story coupled with stunning graphics and a tense plot make for an incredible, enjoyable and unforgettable game. By piecing together various murders in your search for Ethan Carter, we get a sense of the creative and brilliant mind that is Ethan Carter, through the numerous stories we find scattered all around Red Creek Valley.  If you like mystery mixed with horror and suspense, then this game is for you. Seriously, buy this game. You won't regret it.

Really lots of fun to play it. I spend 2 h for this game and I must say it was worth, every single min. This game gives you lots of entertainment and joy, the only problem is that it could be a bit longer, because the adventure is just too amazing for only 2-3 h.
If only I can go to this area if it were real with my photography class.
Dis game gave me too much feel
maybe the first game that i actually refused to use the sprint button because of the beautiful graphics!!

This game drops you off with little to no guidance, this creates a never before seen immersion which is Amazing. The Graphics are jaw droppingly beautiful. The music and ambience creates amazing effects. Loving the storyline so far, although I feel sometimes I'm lost and/or out of place in some sections, not knowing where to go or what to do. Anyhow, it's a game worth the 19.99. Definately worth picking this up, you won't be disappointed.  GRAPHICAL O R G A S M

The Vanishing of Ethan Carter is an exploration/mystery type game. The gameplay basically boils down to exploration broken up by puzzles and story set pieces. The plot itself is fairly simple but the manner you unravel it is pretty compelling. The puzzles are good but not particularly amazing, which is fine as they're not really the point of the game.  Ethan Carter looks amazing, the environments are really interesting to explore and painstakingly detailed. Everything from the leaves and grass rustling in the wind to the mist hanging over the lake to the placement of the rocks, grass and trees in relation to each other in the forests is just right. It runs quite well, my PC isn't top of the line or even close and I managed to run all settings on High smoothly by turning down the Anisotropic filtering.  The music and sound complement the game perfectly and has some really great tracks, the music is not too overbearing and always appropriate for the scene. Sounds are excellent, your footsteps over different surfaces, the creeks of old houses and the wind whistling through the trees all sound just right.  This game drips with atmosphere and is well worth your time. I beat it in maybe 4-5 hours, but it's a really unique experience and well worth the money.
One of my games of the year, I needed a little help online (I'm not the best gamer), but the unique detective system and that ending....unforgettable.
Better than Gone Home.
Great game, bueautiful story, beautiful landscape. I felt it too short :-( but I definitelly will play it again!
This game have one of the most beautiful grafics i ever see 0_o

To simplify things  Buying this game for $19.99 is similar to stabbing yourself with a blunt fork.  You are essentially buying a muffin ata cost of $19.99 when its marginal benefit is only $3.99  So please, ONLY buy this game during sales.  P.S.  Loved the game. Short as ever though.
Better than Gone Home.
Can't recommend enough; thrilling storylines amd immersive visuals creates a beautiful surrealism that I have never experienced in any other game - 10/10
Bought & tried to play this game even my computer below system requirements, turns out it was very lag on my computer.  'Reccomended' for wooden PC gamers.

This game is hands down amazing. I played for four hours, but it had the intensity of 8. The story grips you, the mechanics flow, the visuals stun you and the audio makes your hands stand on end in dread or in awe... Okay, perhaps slighty exaggerated, but whatever, it's awesome!  This game does come with some cons though. - It's very short. If I hadn't gotten this on 50% sale, I'd been dissapointed - though a good 9 seems to be a fair price to me. - The ending is a plot twist, mostly because of how cliche it is. I didn't like it at all, and I'd definitely like to rant about it, but that would spoil it. It drew similarities to a Twillight plot device, along with plot devices used by all sorts of rookie storytellers, let's put it like that. Luckily, this 'end' lasts about 5 minutes tops, so it's not great loss. Note: The end does make sense though, and does tie all the loose ends together - and even then I'd still think it better had the loose ends not been tied up. - In the beginning, it said it wouldn't hold my hands, so I thought the game would be difficult. It wasn't. It wasn't at all. At least not to me. I see others disagreeing with me, saying you 'might miss something', and granted, I didn't get 100% of all achievements... But I don't see where they're coming from. Then again, I love mystery games and PoC games, so that might be why.  I can't think of any other con, so yea. It rocked. Big time. =)
best game have played so far
I liked it but thought the game was too short.

Pros: + Amazing graphics, the best I've seen in any game -- Ever. + Intriguing story. + Fun, and non-frustrating puzzles. + Like nothing you've ever played before. A breath of fresh air.  Cons: - 95% of the world has absolutely 0 interactivity. I wish there were more newspaper clippings, letters, or Ethan's notes or stories scattered throughout the world to reward exploration. The world is amazingly and jaw-droppingly beautiful but since there's almost nothing to discover, you end up just running at full speed through it.  Neither Pro nor Con: ~ The game is 4-5 hours long. That can be good or bad depending on what you're looking for in a game. I thought it could have been just slightly longer, maybe one more puzzle area. But overall, I was in the mood for a short game and this filled it perfectly.  I purchased this for about $15 and I felt like I overpaid slightly. Anything under $12 would be a great price point to purchase this. I would recommend this if the style of the game suits you, and you pick it up on a Steam sale.
Overrated BUT yet an interesting adventure. Terrible ending though.
Buy this game if you like solving puzzles and want something incredibly immersive. Don't buy this game if you want to shoot people or play something longer than a few hours.
Incredible atmosphere and stunningly beautiful. Though short (finished it in 3 h), this game delivers a gripping story perfectly through explorationa and detective work.

Obviously this game is stunning. Gameplay it's very slow paced, but intriguing and engaging if in the right headspace for this sort of thing. Mostly you just wander around until you stumble on a puzzle or murder, and then put clues together to figure out what happened. I lvoe some of the weirder and darker turns the story has taken. I also really appreciate that, as the game warns when started, this is a narrative EXPERIENCE with ZERO HAND HOLDING. Don't expect a single hint as to where to go or what to do. One puzzle in particular really stood out as feeling worthwhile once I figured out what exactly I was supposed to do completely on my own. In any other game it would have been an empty exercise because they would have told me how to do it, but genuinely figuring out the puzzle from mechanics to completion was rewarding. Overall well worth $20 but not certainly not for everyone. Minimal ineraction with environments, no enemies, no inventory, no weapons. Just using your brain.

If you ever looked at a Thomas Kinkade painting and thought to yourself, 'Man, It would be awesome to solve a Lovecraftian Murder mystery inside that painting.'...Well, then you are a strange person.  But, you would definately like this game, because it is: A) Gorgeous B) Mysterious C) Crazy spirit ritual? D) Profit!!!  I'm not so hot on the voice acting, and the autosave system is...flawed. However the ambiance, atmosphere, and intriguing narrative more than make up for that. It's like a hybrid of Myst, Murdered: Soul Suspect and the crime investigations from Batman: Arkham Origins...with more Kinkade vistas.   Did I mention this game was purty? It's purty.  ...Purty.
Graphically pleasing, good soundtrack and the puzzles kept me entertained. Story was interesting and had a good twist at the end. Shory was short, but in all I felt it was worth the $20.
If nothing else, this is the best looking computer game I've ever players. Nice, chilled gameplay, shame its so short.

You have only made a few steps in the forest that you are already struck by this disturbing, mysterious and dream-like atmosphere. You will discover little by little all by yourself (there is no objective marker, there is no map at all till the last minutes) the valley and its secret through story pages left by a young boy that you are tasked to find.  Puzzles are rather simple, very intuitive but the strength of the game is making you plain actor of their resolution : you will collect clues and then reassemble events that form a whole that looks surrealist at first and plainly makes sense in a conclusion that kept in store a clever and moving twist.  As someone who always loved writing stories since childhood this game definitely rings a bell and capture the beauty and power of imagination.
Weow. This game is one of the best I've ever played. You don't find many games like this that at the end make you to think what you actually did at your life    10\10 -One of the best games

Gorgeous, atmospheric, has a few interesting puzzles and a great story with an ending that lingers long after you're done playing. The only caveat: it's around 3 hours in length. If you can't justify spending out on this, you might want to wait for a sale.

I believe that this game broke new ground in terms of video games. They used a method of creating 3d objects called 'photoscanning' which basically means 'take hundreds of pictures of an object from every possible angle' and then the pictures are compiled into a photo-realistic 3d object. Pretty amazing. Anyway, this game might seem very slow and boring, but it gains momentum throughout.  Graphics: 11/10 (Best-looking video game I have ever played) Gameplay: 8/10 Story: 10/10 - The story, in my opinion, was extremely unique and there were no plot holes as far as I am concerned. I loved it.   Overall, this game has turned into one of my favorite indie games.   ~fin~

WOW! This is a different experience! The environment is very much alive and visually stunning. By far the best I have seen. No grinding, no high scores it's just you, the environment, the soundtrack and the story line. If you enjoy great visuals coupled with an excellent sound track, this is not an experience you want to miss.  Go check out some of the screenshots I uploaded!

While this game may be quite short (took me 4 hours to 100%), what it lacks in length it makes up for in it's story. This game is outstanding. You play as a mysterious detective, searching for a young boy who vanished name Ethan Carter. To tell anymore would spoil the story. The graphics are spectacular, absolutely stunning, as well as the soundtrack that fits perfectly with the atmosphere of the game. But be warned, this game is quite difficult due to the fact there is literally NO HANDHOLDING. You are thrust in the game to do as you wish. It's the least linear game out there. All in all it is a fantastic experience and is worth $20 easily, most definitely the $11 it is on sale right now. What are you doing still reading, buy the game.
Weow. This game is one of the best I've ever played. You don't find many games like this that at the end make you to think what you actually did at your life    10\10 -One of the best games

This is a fun game with great narration and a wonderful story. The graphics are gorgeous and it was fun trying to figure out what supernatural goings on were happening in the sleepy little town.   I'm pretty happy with how it all concluded, and i would say that although it has about 3-5 hours of gameplay I dont feel cheated at the $19.99 price tag.  If you're not really into noir-ish games that dont have any gameplay beyond detective type puzzles then this probably isnt for you.  However, if you like great plot, breathtaking visuals, and a surprisingly pleasent music score this is definitely something you want to get.

I'm certain that there are quite a few people who will call The Vanishing of Ethan Carter a boring and pointless walking simulator. Well, they are partially correct.  The Vanishing is not exactly what I would call a game. It's more like... an experience. If I had to name a similar “game”, it would be Dear Esther.  Don't expect to run around and kill things here. What you will do is walk around and investigate the disappearance of a boy called Ethan Carter. You will solve some puzzles, find some 'hidden' objects etc. Now... I'm not sure, but it may be possible to “finish” the game without solving anything, so far I have looked into every corner of the Valley I laid my eyes upon, found a few “secrets”, solved every puzzle and I'm not done yet, though I guess I'm not far now from the end.  The game has absolutely phenomenal atmosphere. There is a sense of calmness but also you have a feeling that something is not right, and it might not be a good idea to stick around. That atmosphere is built by impossibly pretty visuals. Graphics are... let's just say: I made quite a few wallpapers for myself during very first minutes of the game. Apart from visuals the sound is also 1st class. Ambient sounds of the forest are very realistic, other places have their own specific ambiance. Also music fits the game perfectly: it is there, you are aware of it, but it's not too intrusive. Also it changes depending on your location. And there is the voice acting. The main character is perfectly calm, a bit bored detective who just wants to finish the job and go home. Other characters are voiced maybe not as well, but still I can't complain.  Overall visuals and sounds are great.  As for not so grand things: Save system is not good. Auto saves are rare and far between, there is no manual save, if you exit the game you loose everything since last save, and sometimes it's not easy to know if you will loose 2 minutes or half an hour. That being said, Game now downloads a patch that is going to improve that, so this point may not be very valid.  And... well, that's it really.  The Vanishing of Ethan Carter is not a long game that should be treated as an experience rather than an adventure. Fans of Dear Esther will love it. Fans of Call of Duty... won't. I'm the former.
Just one word.....Astonishing!

With about three and a half hours into The Vanishing of Ethan Carter; it was truly an amazing game. The story not only being well written, with heart racing and tense moments in the game truly adding an intense and highly enjoyable atmosphere in the game. The Vanishing of Ethan Carter may be one of my favorite games of 2014; with the beautiful scenery and amazing story telling I will have to definitely recommend this game to anyone with a strong computer and with the desire of adventure and a feeling for above-average challenges within a game. The Vanishing of Ethan Carter does not fail to live up to it's expectations, in fact TVEC surpassed those expectations by quite a lot. I highly recommend this game for those looking for mystery and adventure.
Review so far:  The graphic of this game is amazing! You do not believe it until you were in the world as player yourself.
great exploration game and beautiful as well

A difficult test of puzzle solving ability, patience, and memory. Most may be turned off from the game's reluctance to provide information, direction, or order of completion to some objectives required. However, if you are looking for a game that pretty much relies on the you doing all the work, this game is for you. Picked it up on Steam summer sale, as it was on my backlist of games to try. I'm glad I did. It was a nice break from the normal run of things. Do not expect action, you will find none here. More a different step in the Myst seriest direction, with a slight Alan Wake environment...\  Should also note that fnishing everything the game has to offer took me less than 4 Hours...with taking in scenery from time to time. Pick it up on sale, a game that short is only justified well below asking price.

Probably one of the best story made and crafted game. It's an amazing story as you go along in the game and each time you find something else out it just gets more and more exciting. i dont regret ever getting this game. i have beaten it but it definitely gives me a whole new perspective on gaming
Beautiful and exquisite! It's a great game....
Nice visuals. Story was waaay to short.
Great visuals, interesting puzzles and a killer story. The ending was worth the ride. Highly recommended!

A amazing game, i made the stupid idea of buying this game though during a sale on the valve complete pack(which i should have bought since its like 100$ norm) but other then my impatience this game was a amazing experience. Take all the time you want to gawk at the scenery though because this game tops in at only about 4 hours. making it one of those short but sweet narrative games.

Absolutely stunning graphics, beautiful scenery, amazing story, and a bit of a tear jerker if you're an easy cryer like I am. 10/10, highly reccommend this game. Though it does indeed say partial controller support, I found it easier to play with my keyboard than with my gamepad but either or is doable.

One of the Best games I played recently. Sotoryline: Awesome start, attractive and addictive in the beggining. However, the end is not so explanatory, leaving me feel like nothing actually happened. Like it's just a dream? Me myself can think of better ending. Graphic: Awesome, feeling like it's real, Took so many screenshots. However, the optimisation is not the best, my laptop is performinng lame in the highest definition. Music: Awesome. Fits the enviorment perfectly, Improve the atmosphere.  Although it's a rather short game but the expirience was so great. Especially the scenery and music. Recommend to anyone. Worth the money
Most likely made by a crack team of Russian and Chinese programmers to steal my freedom.

This game is absolutely stunning. The scenery is so beautiful, it's near realistic, and the story telling is so immersive, it keeps you gripped. But here's the thing:  I found that without a guide, it's very nearly impossible to correctly finish this game. Even with a game, I sometimes found myself getting lost. I feel that if I didnt use th guide, my gameplay would easily be ten hours, not five.  This game is gripping, and mysterious, and tragic, and sometimes even scary. As other users have already commented, this game is very short, if you dont get lost a lot like I did, so I would recommend picking this up on sale, instead of playing full price.

I'm about halfway through this game, and I'm truly entranced by the beauty of it. The graphics and music combine to create an atmosphere at times idyllic, and at times foreboding. I haven't seen any jump scares yet (good!) but my mind is often convinced that there is someone (or something) lurking in the woods. While the save system as it is can be slightly annoying, it is certainly not that much of a stumbling block. With the game developers promising to improve this in the near future, the only drawback to the game witll be removed. Highly recommended.

Great game, if a bit short. You're dropped into a large, gorgeously constructed open world and not given very much direction on what to do, other than figure out what happened before your arrival. Much of what you uncover leaves you wondering what just happened, which really makes the mystery seem that much more...mysterious.  Highly recommended if you like games like Myst, enjoy the sort of existential horror/fantasy of Lovecraft, or just want to walk around the woods.

Sorry I'm the lazy type when it comes to writing reviews, but I will say this is an awesome game. The atmosphere is fantastic, the audio is amazing, and the graphics get raved about because they are some of the best of any video game ever. The story is really good imo, very satisfying and short enough to not drag on. Yes this game can be beat in roughly 3-5 hours depending on the person, I personally don't mind that but if you are the type who needs a 10+ hour game then this is not for you. Also yes it is technically a 'walking simulator' but its not ment to be an action game (until you find the sniper rifle) its ment to tell a cool story and show you stunning visuals. In short I highly recommend TVoEC.
Hardcore and a bit frustrating, but truely a masterpiece.
Terrific narration game. There is good mystery and horror in this game as you unravel the story of Ethan Carter.
This game has amazing visuals, amazing atmosphere and an interesting story, If you're into mysteries definitely buy this game
I'm just scratching the surface of this game, but this is already a favorite. Instantly a classic in my eyes.

This game comes the closest to making you feel like a real detective than any detective type of game I have ever played. You have to actually think about the clues that are presented to figure out what went down at each investigation. The world is very beautiful and you could sit there looking at the scenery for hours. Also be warned that this game could make you loose track of several hours of your life that you never knew passed because it is that fun to play. The only thing that I would say that is a downfall of this game is that it does not have enouph investigations to do. I would have loved to have been able to do a lot more of them.

Best game ever made.  Environment is by far the most photorealistic world I have ever played in a game.   The story was so crazy, it kept you playing even though it was only 4hrs in length.  The ending was by far one of the best I've ever seen.  11/10 this game is worth $20. You'll even suggest paying more for so much detail in the world.
Epic story, great puzzles, wonderful scenery. 10/10
Was a big fan of Dear Esther and this game has dethroned it. Very captivating, well designed and cleverly written.
the game itself is great........but short......like really short. but looking past all that there is a really fun game in there. worth the time but maybe not the money.

FIRST OFF! I would like to give the devs two thumbs up for this masterpiece!!!  THIS STORY IS WHATEVER THE PLAYER WANTS TO MAKE OF IT. The game is beautiful in terms of aesthetics and its story. Personally, I was initially on the fence as to what should be expected from this title as it is not my usual genre (usually having a preference for platformers and shooters) and some negative feedback with regards to the game ending and 'game save' issues had me worried. With regards to the 'save point' issues I read about, I EXPERIENCED NONE. As for the story, if you choose to take the story events at surface value you may have a negative experience, but I implore you to search the story for the deepest implications it could have and hopefully this work will leave you content at the very least.   Pros: + Amazing Graphical Style + Beautiful Soundtrack + In-depth Story + Decent/Good Voice-acting + Intuitive Game Mechanics + Puzzle Quality; Hard enough usually to make you think for a second but generally not hard enough to cause frustration + Environmental Exploration Opportunities  Cons: - Skipping over puzzle locations can lead to the need for back-tracking, which some may find frustrating - Dialogue sometimes cuts short if you leave from a 'scene' area too quickly (rare occurrence) - Environmental Audio Transitions; on occassion environmental sound transitions are too abrupt (an example, would be standing in a doorway and hearing no sound from a nearby waterfall and then hearing it roar the moment you exit the doorway) - Lack of combat for those that appeals to - Somewhat short with around 5 hours of playtime  ***PURCHASING/AVOIDING POINTS***  ***ABSOLUTE must-buy if looking for a quality game with a reasonable price-tag*** ***AVOID if walking through the environment to find areas of interest bores you as you will have to do this some***  I absolutely recommend this game and to those who play it, enjoy the ride.
An amazing game with an Amazing story! Just finished the game Only took me like two hours tho

This is a beautiful, but short game. Broad landscapes and lush environments. There are times you would be hard pressed to see the difference between the game and a photograph. Just keep in mind that my total time playing was about 3 hours, and that was with going back through the environment to see things I may have missed.  The gameplay is interesting. It's a puzzler and you're the non-violent party, with plenty of violent scenes around you to resolve. The first, or some may say second, puzzle is the most complicated of them, but it sets a pattern that can be readily followed. (The first 'insight' is more of a exploration.)   This follows in the path of Alan Wake, but with a story heavy, non-violent approach. It tells a story and tells it beautifully in a series of framed situations. There are some gristly and frightening situations, but it definitely a puzzler, not a survival horror. You'll get a chance to review and act on puzzles you didn't get to unlock the ending.  The weakest part of this game ends up being the acting for the English voiceovers, unfortunately. There were good spots with your character, but I think either by subduing the audio a bit or by framing the situations better for the actors, it would have meshed better.  Overall, a beautiful, poetic walk at points with a heavy, foreboding atmosphere.
Awesome game so far. However like others have pointed out, why does this game not show you when it is saving or even why is there no manual way to save...
Beautifully rendered, exellent story, captivating and full of twists. but its a very short game.

From the moment I saw the trailer to this game I was hooked. Rapt. Pierced through the heart by the harpoon of mystery and dragged beneath the turbulent waters of unfathomable horror, and I enjoyed every white-knuckled second of it. I'm not going to spoil anything for you, but from what I can say about the story, the protagonist, Paul Prospero emerges from a tunnel, through a portal into Red Creek Valley, and things just get weirder from there. While I'm not one to gush about visuals and atmosphere of a game, this particular game manages to take superlativeness to a whole new level when it comes to looks and atmosphere.  The setting, the fine details had me on my toes literally from the first minute, and had me asking a lot of questions come the end of the first 'sensory' scene. The kinds of questions that gnaw at your sense of comfort and stability, eat away at your confidence in the mundanity of reality. I particularly loved the way the game handles its doses of startle and fright, getting the dosage in that sweet spot that makes your stomach backflip whenever you hear the strings twang or the sound of an otherworldly moan. One little segment of the game in particular scared me in a way I haven't been since the original STALKER, and to a far better degree might I add. Until today I have never dreaded the thought of being in a cave underground as much as I do now. I am scarred for life and I have never enjoyed the experience more.  There are only two drawbacks to this game that I can think of: The first is its length. Entirely forgivable given the amount of work that has clearly gone into making the game. The second is the way the game's progression can be obfuscated at times. While a horror game is rarely enhanced by extra degrees of handholding, surely a game with such wonderfully written narration and oodles of interleaved details in all of its backstory could tell us how to use Paul's abilities through his own words, and maybe, just maybe, make a few of the more difficult items/doors/buttons/etc. a teensy bit easier to find?  But other than those two tiny things I have yet to enjoy a single horror game more than I've enjoyed this interactive story. Worth every penny you pay for it.

Here is one game where you will figure out the entire story once you reach the end. The graphics are stunning with a few stutters happening even on my machine. Other than that, the main issue would be the price versus the time it takes to reach the end. About $20 for 5 hours of gameplay is a bit excessive. Now, if you can find it on sale, I would recommend the game. Another thing, you are suppose to freely explore...well I would say the game is fairly linear overall. Good concept that would need a little bit more work or content to make it an excellent game.

This is a great adventure/mystery game with absolutely beautiful aesthetics. The puzzles may not be as challenging as those found in mystery game classics like Myst, but the atmosphere of the game and sense of exploration is wonderful.
Beautiful, moving, full of surprises.

Holy. Crap. This game is beautiful. The storyline in itself is worth twenty bucks, it was like watching a movie. I can't begin to explain how wicked the scenery is. It's a really good thinker. I may have had to look for help once or twice, but it's just because I'm impatient. The end scene really hit it home.

Obtained the game on DVD, it loaded some from the disc and the rest from Steam, didn't take very long. The game starts off with a 'home window' giving a pleasant view and a small 'what do you want to do' selection. The game runs smoothly with only a very occasional slight jerk. The graphics are excellent (have to state I run a high end games machine).  There aren't any instructions with the game, you have to find your own way. However, there are suggestions which can't be missed and also thoughts of the detective (you) appear from time to time which helps. Paths can be followed and progress can be made meandering through rocks on occasion, but if there isn't a way forward motion completely stops. The background music is mainly quiet and orchestral - it fits the game really well and adds greatly to the rather creepy/sinister atmosphere. The only point I would question is the autosave as the game progresses. These don't appear to occur very regularly and consequently if the game is left it can be that a considerable amount of the journey already completed has to be re-done. Perhaps it would have been better if the programmers had built in a save function for the player to activate? Then again, perhaps there is more to achieve before the next save can be made. Overall the game is excellent. It is the opposite of the 'point a gun and walk about shooting people' kind of game. Recommended without hesitation.

Great game, awesome expirience, and my first indie game. Beautiful graphics, great music that is perfectly matching everything here. Story line is great maybe not a masterpiece but I've really enjoy it. Thanks 'The Astronauts'!
One of the best mind f----. LOVE IT more to come soon!
worth the buy just to see the amazing graphics. but also a great game some very fresh ideas.
Beautiful visuals and music. Tons of detail. Worth the play.

well, what do I say? it's a beautiful game. it really tries your patience, but it's worth it in the end. this kind of cinematic storytelling should be far more prevelent in video games. I admit, I cheated a peaked at walkthroughs because I was going mad just trying to find hidden things. the game actually reminded me a bit of Alan Wake without the guns and the flashlight.

Some games just captures your and drags you into the game, this is one of those games, you dont really know alot but you enter this wonderfull open world area, but soon the whole sunday walk gets cut short by ..... well you just have to take a look yourself. But a easy game to play not a load of bottons to use, its simple lovely and very entertaning and not tons of load screens :)  :)

Two things you should know before buying this game:  1. It is short  Sadly, this is the only gripe I have with this game. I wish i could spend more time exploring more of the town, getting to know its inhabitants, solving more puzzles, hiking through the forest. I beat the game in 4hrs.  2. This game doesnt guide you in any form.  There is no tutorial, there are no hints, there are no waypoints, there is no map, you dont have an inventory. You figure it out all by yourself. Which at times leaves you wondering off aimelessly through the woods.  In the end, I enjoyed it. I like how the story evolves out of the puzzles you have to solve. Its something new and different but if you like to be lead by the hand or told what to do next, then youll get frustrated. Graphically, this game is amazing to look at and would wander endlessly if they allowed me to. This is a one-and-done title as there is no replay value at all, the story seems to suggest other stories and hopefully more come out, hopefully longer and with some replay value.

Vanishing of Ethan Carter is a terrific little minigame. It takes about 3-5 hours to play through depending on how much you wanna stay and enjoy the environment. This game is the most beautiful game I have seen yet so far and the atmosphere is absolutely stunning with it's graphic combined with gameplay, open world and fitting music.   The story is a mysterious, crimesolving and thriller like genre and with your supernatural detective skills you must solve the case of the kid Ethan who's gone missing without any visable signs at first. You soon encounter some dark and creepy scenarios and while you try to solve the case you become more and more dragged into something you dont understand at first.   The game does not help you with many clues and even though it's not the hardest game the openworld and the gorgeous graphic makes you just wander around sometimes wondering what to do. The puzzle part is quite enjoyable and creative and even though it's not that many obsticles it's fun to play through atleast once or twice.  If you have a couple of hours to spare and like storytelling games with good scenarios, atmosphere and great music I suggest you should check this out :)

Short but sweet.  Using a minimalist approach The Vanishing of Ethan Carter can take off the numerous training wheels common in game design today such as nav beacons and HUD while still remaining brief and effective. Good writing makes the story worth following and interesting to unravel.  Mechanically it's closer to games like Myst or Robot City than Dear Esther for all its brevity because The Vanishing of Ethan Carter is actually a game like Robot City and Myst and not a pile of bad prose shoved down unwitting players' throats like Dear Esther. The puzzle mechanics are straightforward and interesting, not rocket science but not condescending either. The usual question at the heart of each one is 'how did these things come to be as they are now?' and it reinforces the thematic importance of imagination as escape from the quotidian. What looks at first like an abandoned town turns out to be more, then more again.  I was frankly amazed at how their techniques managed to yield such impressive results in the aging Unreal 3 engine. There are very few moving objects in the game but the world as a whole is incredibly detailed in a deliberate fashion. Art direction ties well into the macabre mechanics involved in reconstructing various characters' personal histories and the sense of a day frozen near magic hour is both visually stunning and a massively important plot point. It really does feel like every piece of the game fits in a larger sense.  The only mechanical gripe I have is the lack of manual saves. I recommend switching to the Polish audio with English subtitles. The voice actors just seem to deliver their lines with a more natural sense of conviction in Polish.  The Vanishing of Ethan Carter won't resolve the 'length versus quality' debate but it does put a solid marker in the 'short but well done can be worthwhile' camp.  Give it a look if you like first-person exploration-oriented puzzle games or just interesting experiments in design backed up by solid execution.
Pretty good, Strong story even if it is way too short...  Game play is limited but for reasons.  The minus is that the world is not open.

The game is an interesting experience--and definitely a fun couple of hours. The mechanics and visuals are about as polished as you could want.  Before your read any further...     I definitely recommend this game!
Beautiful colorful world with a nice story with it.

I really enjoyed this game. The puzzles are not very hard at all, and there isn't a ton of challenge, but that really isn't what the game is about. The puzzles and actions are more a form of interactive story. Because of this, that which remains to be judged is the story and atmosphere; and that is a good thing, as both are outstanding.   I found the story to be interesting, creepy, touching, foreboding, and filled with sorrow. The atmosphere is wonderful. The visuals are beautiful, yet completely convey the sense of a long abandoned town. The subtle details throughout are wonderful (make note of the few clocks you find). The music is beautiful and the feel and emotion of if it is applied effectively at the right times. 'The Vanishing of Ethan Carter' is a wonderful experience.

The Vanishing of Ethan Carter, a gripping story that will surprise you over and over again. I like the way how you slowly uncover the mysteries in the game. The world and the graphics are beautiful, the music is amazing and most of the voice acting is more than OK.  Even though it's kind of an open world with no hints, I still completed this game in around 4 hours, in which I spent maybe 1 of them trying to figure out where I was supposed to go next. This might make the game seem a bit too short, but honestly, I'm satisfied. The game doesn't cost that much anyway.  8/10

Loved this game. The story is intensly immersive. There were many times I jumped out of surprise, or had to take a break and think about how to solve some puzzles. The story has many twists, and those twists are amazingly well done. Eventually it all starts to click with one hell of a finish. I couldn's stop playing some sessions because I had to figure out the mystery. Visually, I had to stop at some of the vantage points and just take it all in. It makes me want to visit some similar places I know out east. Perhaps its time for a small trip...  9/10.   It could have been longer, but I don't know if I could have the patience to solve more mysteries. I wanted to see the end of the story so bad, ha!
Good athmosphere and excellent grphics, but don't expect a long gaming experience.

First off, very, very short game. Took me maybe 4 hours, and I was taking my time. What's here is very, very good, though. Probably one of the best looking games I've ever played, and it runs really smooth considering the quality of the textures and everything, even without a top-of-the-line rig. Gameplay-wise, I really like the simplicity of everything. They don't waste your time with a tutorial (you've played video games before, figure it out), and there's really only one button to interact with the world. The investigation stuff and puzzles aren't very hard, but they are pretty unique. This game is more about story-telling than making you struggle through challenges. The atmosphere of the whole game is excellent, and the soundtrack backs it up very well. Overall, an increbily polished game that's entertaining to play and has a cool story. I just wish there was more of it. 9/10  PROS:  Graphics, soundtrack, simplicity, story, originality, polish  CONS: Length, infrequent auto-saves

So I've just completed the game. Took me almost 8 hours, a significant portion of which I've spent running around, trying to figure out what I'm supposed to do next. Fortunately the graphics are beautiful and create an interesting atmosphere.  It's a relatively new kind of genre - an exploration adventure, similar to 'Gone Home'. You explore the world and solve a number of relatively easy puzzles while soaking in the sights and sounds. If you've played adventure games in the 90s then you're probably overqualified when it comes to puzzle-solving. Still entertaining though.  The story is a neat little supernatural mystery. It wouldn't really stand on its own (like as a book), but fortunately it doesn't have to. The atmosphere is achieved through well-matched graphics style, sound and little stories. There's a kind of horror that relies on atmosphere rather than jump-scares - for the most part at least. It makes the game more interesting and engaging rather than making you too scared to play it. Except for one part which might get a tiny bit uncomfortable and seems a bit out of place.  Technically the game is quite solid. The graphics are basically spotless (photographed textures, skillfully put together). Unfortunately Eyefinity/Surround doesn't work out of the box, which would have been nice for people with 3 screens. Also I don't like it when first-person games don't show your legs/feet. Player movement is very basic - you can walk or run and whenever you get to a steep slope / water / any place that might get you hurt, you bumb into an invisible wall. I haven't experienced any bugs.  The one problem with the design is the save system. I won't spoil anything by telling you that the game is made up of a few puzzles / murder mysteries strewn across the world, with each puzzle occupying a very small area. The game only remembers whether you completed a puzzle or not - incomplete puzzles will not be saved! Remember that when you temporarily give up on one puzzle and move on to the next.  I bought the game when it was on sale, like 9€ or so. That was a fair price for the experience, and I hope to discover more games like it.

What a wonderful little game. It doesn't took very long to play it through, but you will experience so many things by every step you take.   The most astonishing part was environment. Take a break, have a look at beautiful setting and enjoy. But don't forget to continue!

The environment was gorgeous, the story was captivating, and the investigations were intriguing. However there were two minor disappointments with this game for me. The first was that the ending was a little too much like an M. Night Shyamalan movie. The second was that it was far too short. I wanted to walk in the scenic Red Creek Valley forever, solving mysteries as 'a detective with paranormal abilities'. The long and short of it is that I would recommend this game, but I just hope it doesn't leave you wanting something more, like it has left me.

The game is short, but MAAAAn this was a good game that you cant stop playing! I give it 9/10, if it had been longer it would get 10/10 and that's not something i give games these days. Just buy it! ;)

Undeniably one of the best looking games on PC. It was a hell of a ride (or walking to be precise) even though a short one. The Vanishing of Ethan Carter lets you play as Prospero who must investigate and find, as the title suggests, Ethan Carter. As i play through, i find my self stopping every 5 minutes to take screenshots of each location. That's how beautiful this game is. The sounds and musics also fit in very well with the graphics. This alone makes it worth more than half of the game price. The other half is the feeling of wanting more as you discover the story of this game. While some may say the story and the puzzles are simple, i find them to be the right mixture at its own pace. Strongly recommended!!
This was a good game I liked it alot but to me it was all to short. It gave me 3 hours of gameplay so I say don't buy it until it is around 5-7$
I see dead people.  Looks great, sounds great and plays great   8/10 even if it's a little short ( that's what she said).

'This game is a narrative driven experience that does not hold your hand'. That's the message at the beginning of the game, and it resonates through the game in a profound way. An excellent story-driven, exploration-based murder mystery and then some with gorgeous graphics, superb pacing and a world that will pull you in tight.  A truly fresh game well worth your time and money.
The Vanishing of Ethan Carter is a beautiful narrative experience. If you have the patience to appreciate the world of Ethan Carter, you'll most definitely enjoy this game.

The type of horror found in this game is entirely unique. The rusty, autumn visuals exhibit a spooky beauty to the dead town of Red Creek Valley. Honestly, this is the only game in my knowledge where I can feel anxiety by simply staring at a waterfall. Where most horror games instill a fear of what is to come, this game focuses on the gruesome mystery of what has already happened, heavily relying on the player’s own imagination. Feelings of fear and wonder will combine to create an aura of anxiety, present throughout.   The plot is all over the place. It’s fairly experimental and nonlinear, but poetically satisfying. It’s not the type of game that needs to be played in one sitting.   The music sounds like someone threw a million dollars at it. The different tracks are fairly catchy too, and they support their visual environments.  There are a few cons to this game. Maneuvering around can be a bit choppy. The voice acting is adequate but not amazing. The save system is automatic and too infrequent. There are a few typos, and the transposition of the audible dialogue to the text on screen is not always perfect.   All in all though, this was quite an ambitious idea for a game, and it actually turned out amazing.
Wonderfully creepy.
great game!!!
Beautiful game, although pretty short. Enjoyable (but not very challenging) puzzles that tell the story as you piece them together.

Took me 4 hours to finish the game (with minor backtracking, maybe 15 minutes). The puzzles/murders are not difficult to solve and there are only a few of them; the graphics are superb and the sound ambience is really good! I didn't like the 'maze' in the mine... There fore 9/10 - buy if you want a nice little story!

This is one of the best games I have played in a while. Is it frustrating to guys who like linear games or platformers, ABSOLUTELY!!! I was frustrated till I looked up a guide just to get some hints. The joy of this game is the atmosphere, the world, and the story. Puzzles are not super hard, but you will miss stuff just because you are busy looking at the world.  It's a short game, deep, dripping with atmosphere, and an ending that will leave you thinking.

I really don't know where to begin, this game moved me the way only a few games in the past could do. It is a walking simulator / adventure game / horror-thriller movie with a detective novel essence. Incredible graphics, almost real life like, the soundtracks reminded me of the naive Miyazaki movies, a little sad deep inside, a little wondrous like a child. I played it like a tourist as well, took so many screen shots I almost felt like a Japanese tourist in Istanbul... And you would play this game even if it lasted 4 years to complete, it would be a hell of a journey... Buy it play it, digest it, remember it...
Very good game. However something is missing in the story for me.

Spooky games are less frightening when you've got an arsenal of weapons... not the case in this game. All you have it what is on your shoulders. Use it well and you'll have a great time! Gorgeous game... I find myself stopping to look around and admire the world I'm transported to. Enjoy the mysteries... must play.
Astounding storytelling and graphics! Kicks Gone Home in the ballz. Kind of short, I devoured it in about three hours, but well worth the experience, no matter how much time you spend on it.

i feel a sense of loss at having completed this game. it was a short experience, tightly wrapped and paced with real atmosphere without the need for jump-scares, and while it ended at the right time i still find myself wishing for more. play it if you want an experience that will stay with you for a long while, try this game.
Amazing game with an awesome storyline. Main character walks rather slow and it got a tad irritating but it wasn't enough to make me not want to play. Highly recommended.
If you enjoyed classic adventure series of yore such as Myst, Zork, 7th guest, 11th hour then this game is for you. Great atmosphere, pretty amazing graphics and a gripping story.
Eerie, atmospheric, and at times unsettling, this game was indeed short but sweet. I enjoyed every minute of it.

Great little autumn game. It looks beautiful, runs without a hitch and the atmosphere is thick and it doesn't hold your hand at all, which invites exploration both of the games mechanics and its world. The game is like the artwork and soundtrack to a short story, it just flows on.  The game is short, maybe five or six hours, but in my opinion that's just enough. The only downside is that.. section in the mine, which breaks the mood and rythm of the game, but the reward for going through it is pretty great.  I would definately say go for it!

I've only played this game for a very short amount of time but I'm addicted. This game is immersive, beautiful and incredible atmospheric. I love the film noir narrative. It has a Lovcraftian feel to it and is slow but sensitively paced.   10/10 for me, brilliant!

Short but excellent game. The visuals are stunning and the music is perfect (definitely worth getting the collector's edition for the soundtrack). Neat ending too. The mechanic of reconstructing the events is well implemented. The puzzles are pretty straightforward...the main challenge I found was in locating them rather than completing them.
stunning visuals good narative good atmosfear and sound design make the an immersive game
One of the few games to make me feel like an accomplished sleuth. Beautiful atmosphere, intriguing and rewarding puzzles, and an overall sense of uneasiness. BUY IT!

The Vanishing of Ethan Carter, a gripping story that will surprise you over and over again. I like the way how you slowly uncover the mysteries in the game. The world and the graphics are beautiful, the music is amazing and most of the voice acting is more than OK.  Even though it's kind of an open world with no hints, I still completed this game in around 4 hours, in which I spent maybe 1 of them trying to figure out where I was supposed to go next. This might make the game seem a bit too short, but honestly, I'm satisfied. The game doesn't cost that much anyway.  8/10

A amazing game, i made the stupid idea of buying this game though during a sale on the valve complete pack(which i should have bought since its like 100$ norm) but other then my impatience this game was a amazing experience. Take all the time you want to gawk at the scenery though because this game tops in at only about 4 hours. making it one of those short but sweet narrative games.

This is a beautiful story telling experience. If you're into books, and a bit into mysteries, then jump on board the (blood covered) train! You play as a detective Paul Prospero who is looking for....wait for it....Ethan Carter! So sit back, and enjoy the ride.  8.5/10  The only issue I had with the game is that at times you lost sense of direction. You didn't know where to go or what to do. But, this is explained in the opening scene with the note of 'No Hand Holding'. I would have liked something to nudge me in the right direction, but this falls under my own opinion.
Most likely made by a crack team of Russian and Chinese programmers to steal my freedom.

The most graphically beautiful game I have played to date ! Loved all of it, but would have changed the ending of the game. Will re-visit the game just to walk around & take in the beauty of the environments.

Amazing, to be honest the game mechanics werent clear to me to begin with and I have to admit I looked at some walkthroughs.  Once you learn the game mechanics sit back and enjoy the story.  The gameplay is very emersive and the graphics... wow... if you thought skyrim was great wait until you see this game! The soundtrack deserves its own recognition well a perfect fit to the ambience of the world around you.   The game has many suprises, scary ... dramatic and hell even funny... astronaut?? lol  9 out of 10 thats for sure. check out my screenshots to see the game in 2560x1080 fully maxed out!

Probably one of the best looking games I've played! Just plain gorgeous! Overall a really great game with some minor shortcomings. The game is about finding a young boy, Ethan Carter. There is no hand holding in the game, it even tells you that at the start. You are plopped down in the world and let loose to do what you will. Exploration is the big thing. There is no shooting or fighting or jumping. You cannot die. If I were to compare it to another game, I'd say it is like Myst, but with less puzzles and a darker story. It is definitely creepy at times. A bit like how Alan Wake is. The murder solving aspects are pretty cool, but they are not very challenging. I liked the story, it was original and it has a cool ending. The game is short, around 4 hours. Honestly I wish it was longer because it was really fun to explore. I'm really looking forward to whatever The Astronauts make next!  Pros: -Gorgeous game! Fantastic graphics! Very immersive world. -Pretty cool story. Original idea and it had a cool ending. -Easy to play and really fun to explore. -Dark undertones with some HP Lovecraft flavor. -A bit like Myst and Alan Wake, but with no shooting -Putting the crime scenes together is a unique idea and I enjoyed it.  Cons: -Since you are just free to go where you want, I ended up having to do some back tracking at the end of the game to complete everything. Which was a bit annoying. -I wanted more challenging puzzles. Everything is pretty easy to solve. I don't know if I'd even call them puzzles. In comparison, Myst is more challenging when it comes to puzzles. -Pretty short game, maybe 4 hours. I wish it was longer because it was really enjoyable to explore.  So, if you like games like Myst mixed with an Alan Wake vibe, you would like this! More like Myst though. I highly recommend it!

This game is short. I have not beaten it but i am nearing the end, I can feel it. Other than that, this game is a masterpiece. The gameplay and the visual environment creates an absorbing world where anyone who plays it is easily swollowed up in its story and creativeness. This is a game that everyone has to play atleast once to appreciate a style of gaming that is different from the norm of todays popular games.

I'm not a big review writer but I must say The Vanishing of Ethan Carter is a very well done game with the detailed background and the music and the interesting surprises as you explore further into Ethan's family and background.   I love puzzle games and this went seamlessly with the game play. You wanted to find the answers and not get frustrated halfway through. I would definitely reccommend this to people that like Myst exploritory type games.

The game follows a more old-school approach, of a narrative puzzle (quest) adventure, where there are no spoiler hints, no help mode and no tutorial intro, whatsoever. It's got a somewhat long learning curve, if you're not used to this type of game, but the content is astonishing : You find yourself in a gorgeous open-world scenery (UE3 and UE4-redux version DO make a difference), where you explore and find clues that help you pick up the pieces of the story at your own pace. The graphics are absolutely beautiful and so is the subtle ambient music score that will accompany you to some very memorable locations. The whole scenario, although short, is well written and makes for some gory, dark sense in the process. It's not a lengthy experience, but it's long enough to support the script without falling into unnecessary scenario gaps.   Verdict : Impressive and rewarding for every adventure geek out there. 9/10
Yep, a stunning murder-mistery short story! I'll be ready for some DLC in the coming months.
A beautiful and very well presented game, one of my top 10 favorites of all time. Its worth every penny I spent!
the piano score was one of the best, most fitting game tracks I've ever heard.

Mysterious, captivating, and intriguing -- all the things a game should have. This game does not hold your hand, you have to figure things out like you would in the real world. Very interesting plot and absolutely beautiful graphics. It's a little bit short, and you can easily get through it in one sitting -- but its very much worth it.

Some people may say that the story is cliche or boring but personally I think that it is amazing. Even if the game is only about 3 hours long (a definite negative(I hope the make a squeal)) you can tell how much work was put into it just by the detail and the thought put into it. If you are thinking of getting this game and you like this type of genre then I erge you to buy it, it is definitely worth the $20 price tag.

The graphics are beautiful and really show what can happen when a developer focuses on PC. The small size of the team makes this impressive as well. Story is solid and very enjoyable. Even had some feels. The gameplay and puzzles are light but still fun and interesting. The game is short but not that short. I think you can finish it in around 5-6 hours unless your an idiot like me and overlook something and totally miss how the game works and run around a lot. Yeah, it warns you the game won't hold your hand and it doesn't which is a good thing.
A graphical beauty with an interesting story. A must-have for point-and-click enthusiasts.
This game has stunning graphics and fictional stories as you explore throughout this strange place. 8.5/10

10/10  Positives: - Beautiful landscapes - Great story - none of the puzzles are obscured to a point where they don't make sense but does require some patience - not a long story, great for a boring day  Negatives: - The game has no replayablity as nothing changes. You would only play again if you missed an achievement and if you explored you won't miss any. - SPOILER, you find out the game was all for nothing

Good casual game if you like solving puzzles. Very pretty, but it's more of a time killer than a compelling story. The story was interesting but not particularly shocking, new, or different. The game was really creepy at first but it's not very scary, the puzzles are very straightforward, and I was expecting it to be longer.  Pros: Beautiful visuals and music, nice voice acting, and interesting story. Very eery due to lighting, sound, and general ambiance.  Cons: short, puzzles weren't very difficult, predictable ending (to me at least, I predicted it after the first few notes), a little more than I would have paid for if I knew it was so short.  Reccommended for: casual gamers who like puzzles and good visuals.

Overall a great game that I would reccomend to any puzzle loving explorer.   Pros:  Absolutly beautiful - I never got bored with running around aimlessly when I got stuck because there was so much to look at.  Interesting puzzle mechanics - The main puzzles were fun since you not only had to find/move objects but then decide the order of events. The game also mixes in other puzzles like having to remember the layout of house as you pass through portals, figuring out the correct letters of a name to unlock a door by running around and inspecting dead bodies while avoiding a creepy zombie guy.  Engaging story - You get to see things from the view point of Ethans stories as well as the reality of what inspired the boy to write the stories to begin with. It has a very dark undertone but fits with the vast open world. The ending was sad but very touching.  Music - very soothing at times but creepy at others. All the tracks fit their respective events/areas.  Acheivements - From what I've read the developers were against putting in acheievments before? Not sure why considering I found them helpful. I don't really like the idea of getting all the way to the end just to find out you missed a ton of events that you needed to trigger. So they helped motivate me to explore more and look more carefully. Plus there were a few that made me explore and try doing random things that I wouldn't have normally done - like The Tunnel    Cons:  Buggy - very very buggy. The game froze on me twice when I accidently double clicked while inspecting an item/body. I had to quit and go back into the game after door to the building with the dam pumps wouldn't open (with me stuck inside.) Speaking of quitting to restart - because there is not save option you loose any progress if the game doesn't auto save. This wouldn't be so much of an issue if when you quit the game didn't actually reset. I ended up back near the beginning a couple of times after dealing with the game freezing or bugging out and was very confused when everything I had done in previous puzzles was reset. Also, if you didn't ride the elevator up from the lower area then you'll have to run through the mines all over again to get back down.
Amazing experince, visuals, and story. A mashup of Myst and H.P. Lovecraft, it's a horror novel in the Unreal engine.
Outstanding graphics.
While relatively short, this game is amazing. The graphics are top notch and the story is great.

Absolutely fantastic! The scene, the somewhat mysterious nostalgic feel, the clues, side story that fill the main -- its right on spot. Also loving the hidden jump scare, which is subtle and not too much [a good thrill pace]. The only downside is that I hope for a longer duration from this kind of game.
Awesome game just wish it had been longer.
10 out of freaking 10. The scenery is amazing and the story is riveting. If you enjoy puzzles and detective type games I highly recommend this game.
First 15 minutes of game makes me think it is most beautiful landscape I have ever seen in PC game in real time... new Unreal engine at it best.... tbc
Pretty good, Strong story even if it is way too short...  Game play is limited but for reasons.  The minus is that the world is not open.

I really enjoyed this game despite it only taking about 4 hours to finish. One thing everyone needs to know about this game is that you need to have a lot of patience for it which could turn some away. When first starting the game I walked past a crime scene and figured that it would be solved later on. I played for about an hour with no such luck, so, I restarted the whole thing. Right away I was finding things that I simply strolled past without a second glance. You have to be meticulous to really enjoy this game which was a bit of a downside, but, the payoff for finding every single thing the game has to offer is well worth it. The game, despite being called horror is not very scary. There was only one part that was genuinely scary but it was very brief. Eerie is probably a better word for this game but it gets quite graphic at times. The ending was really well done, albeit a bit sad, but it does a fantastic job of making you think without it being too confusing. This game is short but well worth the $20 and even if you dont want to go through the trouble of beating it, I would reccomend watching a playthrough because the storytelling is really fantastic. 9/10

I really enjoyed playing this game, something new for a change. It looks stunning, the feel of it is very impressive, the sounds and visuals all bind together with the occasional narrative voice-over to make for a very engrossing experience. You will find yourself just stopping to admire the place, as the trees and grass sway in the breeze, you will listen to the distant water and the birds. The music is very well done, not too much and blends well with the mood and surroundings to help lend another layer to the whole experience. The exploration element is very reminiscent of the Myst games but here you have a little more structure to the way in which the clues are pieced together to further the narrative. The main story is supplemented with some very interesting asides, you don't need to do them, but why wouldn't you want explore all of the valley and uncover its' mysteries? My one and only criticsm is that there is not enough of it, so is that a criticsm to say that I want more of this. Probably not, can't wait for more along the same lines from this developer. Maintain the quality and you have a winner.

Summary: Basic run-through of the game takes about 3 hours and it is very linear (ie. no side quests and limited exploration). A very creative and beautiful murder mystery story.  Details: This is one of the most creative and imaginative game's I've ever had the pleasure of playing! The mechanics are extremely well designed, the story is engaging, and the environment is beautiful and immersive. While it is a relatively short game (~3hrs) I imagine many people would play it multiple times to enjoy the puzzles and scenery. I truly hope many more games are made using this same engine.  It should be said, however, that if you are expecting anything more than a well told interactive murder mystery story you will be disappointed. There is no open-endedness to the game and it is extremely linear.
Truly beautiful in every respect.
Really excellent game. Cool puzzles, interesting story, and amazing visuals.
wtf? its really special and amazzzzing

This game is SO PRETTY. It's also a fun game but jesus christ you could take a screenshot at pretty much any point in the game and turn it into a painting. It's a murder mystery walk-'em-up where you are gravelly manly man PAUL PROSPERO, and you find clues to mysterious murders and then use your ghost-o-vision to reconstruct the crimes. There are also some delightfully strange and non-sequiturish side quests along the way - reconstructions of the eponymous Ethan's creative writing come to life.   I don't like horror games, and while this game isn't scary per se ('uneasy' would be a better term), there is one specific section that features jump scares, which I wasn't too happy about, and honestly kinda breaks the flow/feel of the game. I survived though.  The whole experience is about 4 hours, though honestly it's worth it just for all the new desktop wallpapers you'll get out of it.

Definatly worth the $20  PROS:   The visuals are absolutely gorgeous  The music is outstanding  The story is fantastic  There's no HUD to get in the way of the graphics  Controls are easy and fluid  Many WTF moments  CONS:  Wish it was longer =(

HOLY ♥♥♥♥ IS THIS GAME GOOD LOOKING. FORGET ALL YOU KNOW, THIS GAME IS AS REALISTIC AS THEY GET. THE STORYLINE TOO IS COMPARABLE TO A SMALL NOVEL WITH AN AMAZING STORY. LIKE IF THIS WAS A BOOK IT WOULD BE AS POPULAR AS HARRY POTTER (close if not the same) 10/10 would get a uncharacteristic jumpscare again.
This game has amazing landscape and a great story, its a little short but its all good :3

Where to start, it is hard to find such a beautiful game that is so well optimised for us non-top of the range gaming PC people.   The game follows through on its promises and from the start does not hold your hand, but rather leaves you to your own mind to find a way forward through the game.  Besides the amazing visuals that the game has to offer (which are no less than fantastically emersive) The sounds from the scenery around you and narration voice acting are nothing less than what you would expect from a triple A title, so major kudos to the developers of this fantastic INDIE game.   You may find yourself much like myself getting lost for long periods of time in this game as you work your way to the objective.   If you are looking for a brilliantly made Narrative gaming experience then you can look no further for The Vanishing of Ethan Carter is surely one you don't want to miss.
Cool game, but quite short.

hands down one of the best graphics and atmosphere i have seen in a game. i'm the type of gamer that still requires a story to come with my game. ethan carter provides one and it meets my expectation. definitely one of those games you have to play.
This Lovecraftian, very athmosperic puzzle and roam game has stunning graphics and had me on the edge of my seat from start to finish 9.5/10 !!

This is a short visual novel game, its hard to say more with out ruining the plot, but the game takes you through a series of mysterious events in which you piece together the story before reaching it's dramatic conclusion.  This game has such fantastic visuals and takes you through all sorts of narritive creations and unique puzzles. if you are looking for a fun 3ish hour experience play through this game, and explore this story.  9/10
Beautiful game! It was a joy to play

I have a lot of trouble with the 'games are art' thing. I think games always contain art, but their purity of vision is usually hampered in some way: by gameplay mechanics, by economics, by a committee of creators. The Vanishing of Ethan Carter really doesn't feel like that, and I wouldn't hesitate for a second in describing it as art, perhaps the best piece of video game art I've experienced yet.  I've heard of this title being dismissed as a 'walking simulator', which is crude as a pejoritive criticism (it's a long, long way advanced from Dear Esther) but it also backfires. The world in this game is so beautiful, I would happily have bought it just for the exploration. There is a lot more to it, however. I wouldn't say the scene investigations are exactly 'puzzles', but they add an element to the storytelling that makes completing each chapter into a gentle addiction. There are a couple of decent problems to crack, and the easier stuff isn't insultingly simple. It's rewarding enough.  Speaking of rewards, there are a couple of dramatically surprising story moments, including one that will be hugely exciting for fans of a certain horror writer. You crack a code problem in the mine, and then suddenly, 'Ohhhhh... it's YOU'. You'll know it when you see it.

An absolutely great experience to play this game! Though a hint feature would have been very useful as sometimes I just wandered around the whole map not knowing what to do and had to watch walthrough videos on youtube a couple of times....  +Great scenary +Good gameplay +Nice story  -A bit short -Murder cases were very linear and straight forward to solve -No manual save feature

This is a precious little gem. It's a story-driven graphic adventure, with landscapes and locations perfectly created using Unreal Engine. It's original, intelligent and a little scary. Visiting the locations alone is worth the price of the game. ENJOY!

It's rare that you get a game that successfully ties an enthralling narrative with subdued gameplay and doesn't end up a boring hike from set piece to set piece. Making a game that survives on grindy gameplay or balls-to-the-wall action is easy by comparison; you've got an addicting element or two that you can exploit, slap some pretty colors on it, and make a swell profit. The Vanishing of Ethan Carter is much classier than that. It wants to tell a chilling story, but it doesn't want to hold your hand. It knows that you can figure things out with enough time and the proper perspective. The controls aren't complex, and the atmosphere seems to almost set itself: a destitute countryside with an air of age and decay, hinting to something sinister beneath the rock.  You play Paul Prospero, a paranormal investigator, who'd been sent a grave letter from a boy who feared dark forces were consuming his family. From that brief explanation on, you are free to explore the world at your leisure, piece together clues to solve mysteries, or simply follow the tracks the game has set up for you.   As one might expect, the strongest suit of the game is its story, which takes very clear inspiration from the works of HP Lovecraft, and perhaps a bit from The Twilight Zone. The serene beauty of the game also achieves a sense of immersion while you're adventuring across the countryside, and it completely amplifies this chilling sensation of 'relaxed horror', as I like to call it --horror that lacks jumpscares and moments of fear, which are popular in games like Five Nights at Freddy's . (Though I'll let you know, there is a pop-scare or two that you might not be expecting, but they're quite mild).  If I had to call out a few weaknesses, I'd say the puzzles are tremendously easy, and the game is actually rather short, despite the satisfying story. This is counterbalanced by its lovely $20 pricetag, which stunned me considering how beautiful the game looks. There are plenty of new triple-A games out in the market with roughly the same amount of gameplay time, but three times the price (I'm looking at you, The Order 1886).  All in all, if you're even a remote fan of horror and puzzle-games, buy it. It's a relaxing, pleasant experience. It's got some cleverness to the puzzles, and it gets you invested in a simple, but surprisingly clever, yet bitter-sweet, story. For $20, that's a steal by most of today's standards.
This was a wonderful game. Truly stunning in many ways. I thoroughly enjoyed the time I put it.
